news.title: Only 90 out of 1,000 hotels and clubs in Delhi have fire NOC
news.para: Delhi Fire Service data reveals a stark reality: out of nearly 1,000 hotels and clubs, only 90 possess fire safety no-objection certificates. This comes as the city's excise department previously urged establishments to ensure safety measures, highlighting a significant gap in compliance despite regulations.

news.title: Home loans up 14%, but buyer growth lags at 7% in Gujarat
news.para: Gujarat's housing loan disbursals rose 14% year-on-year, indicating robust credit flow. However, a slower 7% growth in borrowers and declining demand, especially in the affordable segment, suggest subdued purchase momentum. Rising property prices are causing mid-income and first-time buyers to delay purchases, impacting overall market activity.

news.title: Kochi apartment owners seek relaxation for installing STPs in old buildings
news.para: Apartment owners in Kerala are urging the Chief Minister to relax STP installation rules for buildings constructed before 2007, citing the upcoming centralized sewerage system. They fear losing occupancy certificates and essential services due to retrospective pollution control board notices. The consortium highlights the significant cost of individual STPs versus the planned city-wide network.

news.title: Andhra Pradesh government begins regularisation of ‘Sada Bainama’ land agreements
news.para: Lakhs of farmers in Andhra Pradesh are set to receive land titles as the government moves to regularize decades-old 'Sada Bainama' agreements. This initiative, driven by Chief Minister N Chandrababu Naidu's directive, aims to provide legal ownership and security to cultivators who have worked land without formal documentation for years.

news.title: Karnataka RERA chairman urges citizens not to accept deficient service
news.para: The real estate regulator, the RERA chairman said, has revolutionized homebuyers' rights by empowering them to demand accountability from developers, and by mandating transparency, timely possession, refunds, defect-free properties, and complete documentation.

news.title: Hyderabad: Flat owners association told to charge maintenance based on flat size
news.para: A consumer commission has ordered the Saket Pranaam flat owners' association to change its maintenance fee collection.  Residents will now pay based on their flat's size.  This ruling follows a complaint from a studio-flat owner.  The association must implement this square-foot based model within 45 days.  It also faces penalties for non-compliance and must pay compensation to the complainant.

news.title: Wakefit's ₹1,289-crore IPO subscribed 15% on day 1
news.para: On its first day of trading, Wakefit Innovations saw its IPO receive a notable 15 percent subscription rate. The retail investor community stepped up, capturing 73 percent of their designated share slice, showcasing robust confidence in the brand.

news.title: Centre sanctions 1.11 crore houses under two schemes of PMAY
news.para: The government has approved over 1.11 crore homes under the Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana. Nearly 96 lakh of these houses are now complete and given to beneficiaries. Slum dwellers are also receiving aid through various housing schemes.

news.title: Larsen & Toubro consolidates its real estate business under L&T Realty
news.para: Larsen & Toubro's board has decided to streamline its real estate division by transitioning all real estate activities into its wholly-owned subsidiary, L&T Realty Properties. This consolidation is set to cultivate a stronger, cohesive brand identity across its real estate ventures, setting the stage for L&T Realty to pursue autonomous growth and attract fresh investments.

news.title: Assam government to hand over 992 acres to AAI for Silchar greenfield airport
news.para: In a major development for Assam's infrastructure, the government has sanctioned a sprawling 3,000 bighas of land for a new modern airport near Silchar. This strategic move sets the stage for the Union Cabinet's green light. Additionally, the state has dedicated land for 1,200 families as part of the Mission Basundhara initiative.

news.title: Omaxe repays over ₹700 crore debt to Samman Capital
news.para: Omaxe Group has repaid over ₹700 crore debt to Samman Capital. This significant repayment was made ahead of schedule, utilizing project cash flows. The company previously cleared SWAMIH-funded facilities for its New Chandigarh and Prayagraj projects.

news.title: Nisus Finance exits Bengaluru’s High Cliff Project with 23% IRR in two years
news.para: Nisus Finance has successfully exited Bengaluru's Project High Cliff, a residential development, achieving a 23% Internal Rate of Return (IRR) within two years. The investment, made through rated, listed non-convertible debentures, provided crucial structured capital to accelerate project execution and overcome delays. This exit highlights the growing importance of specialized real estate credit platforms in addressing market funding gaps.

news.title: Punjab governor inspects key land, housing projects in Chandigarh
news.para: Punjab Governor Gulab Chand Kataria inspected various development projects across Chandigarh, including housing schemes and commercial hubs. He directed officials to incorporate essential amenities in government housing and emphasized transparent operations at the Bulk Material market. The governor also focused on future-ready planning for mixed-use developments.

news.title: Probe ₹93 crore paid by CMRL to landowners: Madras HC
news.para: Madras High Court ordered a probe into 93.4 crore compensation paid by Chennai Metro Rail Limited. This compensation was given to landowners without verifying land titles. The court set aside appeals against land acquisition from 1975. Authorities are directed to take action, including criminal proceedings, if fraud is found.

news.title: Jaipur: JDA demolishes six-storey building in Malviya Nagar, owners say JMC had approved it
news.para: Jaipur Development Authority (JDA) demolished a six-storey under-construction building in Malviya Nagar for lacking JDA permission. Owners claimed Jaipur Municipal Corporation (JMC) sanctioned plans and collected Rs 1.25 lakh, raising questions about civic body coordination. JDA stated the land belonged to them and the building was unsafe.

news.title: Builders unhappy with changes to Punjab’s property law, say will slow down sales
news.para: Punjab's new property regulation act requires promoters to own 100% of project land before development, aiming to curb malpractices and price fluctuations. Developers express concern over slowed development and revenue impact, while buyers anticipate increased transparency and choice.

news.title: Now, centre to untangle Chandigarh's policy knots
news.para: Union Home Secretary Govind Mohan will meet Chandigarh bureaucrats on Monday to address long-standing issues affecting city residents. These include ownership rights for rehabilitation colonies, conversion of leasehold properties, and need-based changes in Housing Board houses. The discussions aim to provide clarity before a meeting with Union Home Minister Amit Shah on December 12.

news.title: Bengaluru development body proposes steep penalty regime on vacant sites
news.para: The Bangalore Development Authority (BDA) will now impose a 10% non-construction fine on allottees failing to build homes within three years, with sale deeds withheld until completion. This measure targets beneficiaries who have illegally transferred plots or left them vacant, despite significant land value appreciation. Exemptions apply to Arkavathy and NPKL layouts due to existing delays and infrastructure issues.

news.title: Ludhiana: GK Group's chairman, sons booked in two separate cases
news.para: Ludhiana police have filed two property fraud cases against GK Group's chairman, Gulshan Kumar, and three sons. One FIR alleges land encroachment for a petrol pump expansion. The second case accuses another son and an associate of fraudulently selling contracted land to multiple buyers. Investigations are ongoing, with no arrests yet.

news.title: Insure common areas or pay for disaster repairs: Karnataka RERA to builders
news.para: Karnataka Rera has mandated that builders must insure common areas, warning they will be liable for disaster repair costs if they fail to do so. A recent order directed a developer to provide insurance documents for a project after a fire damaged a clubhouse, highlighting the promoter's responsibility for uninsured common areas.
